sentences.en: Get the bulbs into the ground, or they will begin to shrivel.
sentences.cn: 把鳞茎种到地里, 否则会开始干枯的.

sentences.en: The leaves change colour, then shrivel.
sentences.cn: 树叶变了颜色，然后干枯了。

sentences.en: The leaves started to shrivel up.
The paper would shrivel and blaze at every touch of the fiery pen.
sentences.cn: 每当那炽热的笔尖落下纸张会皱起,燃烧.

sentences.en: The tetrads eventually shrivel or are resorbed.
sentences.cn: 这种四分体最终萎缩或被再吸收.

sentences.en: Then their seed ripens, and soon they turn brown and shrivel up.
sentences.cn: 随后,它们的种子熟了, 不久就变枯萎.

sentences.en: Though not many positions shrivel to zero, funds do suffer 2 % losses all the time.
sentences.cn: 尽管这只股票不可能跌到毫无价值, 但是基金确实已经损失了2%.

sentences.en: Under the direct sunlight young plants will shrivel up.
sentences.cn: 在阳光的直射下,小苗会枯萎的.

sentences.en: Whenever I go to a party, I shrivel up and hope no one will notice me.
sentences.cn: 每次去参加晚会, 我都紧张不堪,不思让别人注意到我.

sentences.en: Wights are armed with horrible Bane Blades that cause mortal flesh to decay and shrivel.
sentences.cn: 恶灵装备着令人恐惧的怨毒之剑,可令生物的皮肉腐烂干枯.

sentences.en: Your wealth, fame and temporal power will shrivel to irrelevance.
sentences.cn: 你的财富 、 名誉及暂时握有的权力将毫无价值.

words.tran_cn: 使枯萎；使皱缩；使束手无策

trans.tran_cn: (使)起皱纹, (使)枯萎, (使)束手无策
trans.tran_en: Shrivel up means the same as

trans.tran_cn: （因热力，严寒、干燥、年老等而）枯萎，皱缩
